question.text: Which statement is correct about the disorder of skeletal or muscular system?

options.text: Muscular dystrophy - Age-related shortening of muscles.
Osteoporosis - Decrease in bone mass and a higher chance of fractures with advancing age.
Myasthenia gravis - Autoimmune disorder which inhibits sliding of myosin filaments.
Gout - Inflammation of joints due to extra deposition of calcium.

solution.text:
Major causative factors of osteoporosis are imbalances of hormones like calcitonin of thyroid, parathormone of parathyroids, sex hormones, deficiencies of calcium and vitamin D.
Gout- It is a disease which includes metatarsal phalangeal joint inflammation due to deposition of uric acid.
Muscular dystrophy - It is a muscle disease that weakens the musculoskeletal system & locomotion. It includes defects in muscle protein & death of muscle cells & tissues, also known as Duchenne syndrome.
Myasthenia gravis - is an autoimmune disorder leading to muscle weakness & fatigue..
